content: If we can't delete rust-unofficial, I think it probably makes sense to wait until we have a more formal idea of "what belongs in rust-lang" before moving too-many-lists.

Spitballing some "necessary conditions" for migration:

  • If there are current project owners, they want to do the move (for whatever reason) - in the case of too-many-lists, I'm guessing the aforementioned ex-docs member has already been consulted?
  • Migration is unlikely to cause confusion in the community (this is what disqualifies awesome-rust)
  • If any of the current project contributors are not yet part of the rust-lang team, we are willing to give them sufficient access to continue contributing at the same level (not sure how easy or difficult it will be to flesh out this condition)
